subtitle: One login. Every relationship. Unified dashboard.

slides.title: QDB One
slides.subtitle: One login. Every relationship. Unified dashboard.
slides.tagline: Unifying Qatar Development Bank's digital experience.

slides.heading: The Problem
slides.statement: QDB's three portals create a fragmented customer experience
points: Three separate logins — Direct Financing, Advisory Services, Guarantees each have their own portal
No cross-portal visibility — customers can't see all their QDB relationships in one place
Identity duplication — same person exists as different records across portals
Support tickets spike around login/access issues — 40% of customer support volume

slides.heading: The Solution
slides.statement: A unified platform that merges three portals into one seamless experience
points: Master Person Index — resolves identities across all three portals with 98%+ accuracy
NAS-backed single sign-on — one login via Qatar's National Authentication System
Unified dashboard — all financing, advisory, and guarantee relationships in one view
Module Federation UI — seamless navigation across portals without iframes

features.title: NAS Single Sign-On
features.description: SAML 2.0 / OIDC via National Authentication System

timeline.milestone: Architecture complete — MPI, Module Federation, CQRS designed
NAS integration + Master Person Index operational
Beta — unified dashboard with 500 pilot customers
Full launch — all QDB customers migrated

slides.heading: Vision
slides.statement: Set the standard for unified government digital services in the GCC
milestones: 2026: Launch QDB unified platform — 95% SSO adoption
2027: Decommission legacy portals — full migration complete
2028: Replicate framework for other Qatar government entities
